The three arrested include Kenneth Ray Green and Amanda Harkins of Colorado City, pictured to the left and right respectively in the picture below, charged with tampering with evidence...
text:
Three Colorado City residents have been charged and arrested after an
investigation into the death of an Odessa teen.

The investigation by the Colorado City Police Department and Mitchell County
Sheriff's Office began after 16-year-old Haley Martinez was found dead in a
Colorado City home.

The three arrested include Kenneth Ray Green and Amanda Harkins of Colorado
City, pictured to the left and right respectively in the picture below,
charged with tampering with evidence by moving Martinez's body, and Nicholas
Rodriguez, shown in the center, arrested for assault prior to Martinez's
death.

"We have interviewed countless numbers of people, with the sheriffs office,
working together to bring justice to Haley," stated Colorado City Police Chief
Charles Rice.

Authorities do not yet have a cause of death in the case but could issue more
warrants when the determination is made.

An autopsy and sexual assault examination have also been ordered as part of
the investigation.

title: 3 people detained after underage teen-girls death in Colorado City [Legal Monitor Worldwide]
html:
Three Colorado City residents have been charged and arrested after an investigation into the death of an Odessa teen.

The investigation by the Colorado City Police Department and Mitchell County Sheriff's Office began after 16-year-old Haley Martinez was found dead in a Colorado City home.

The three arrested include Kenneth Ray Green and Amanda Harkins of Colorado City, pictured to the left and right respectively in the picture below, charged with tampering with evidence by moving Martinez's body, and Nicholas Rodriguez, shown in the center, arrested for assault prior to Martinez's death.

"We have interviewed countless numbers of people, with the sheriffs office, working together to bring justice to Haley," stated Colorado City Police Chief Charles Rice.

Authorities do not yet have a cause of death in the case but could issue more warrants when the determination is made.

An autopsy and sexual assault examination have also been ordered as part of the investigation.
